ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Magnetospheric Ion Composition Sensor (MICS) from the Charge and Mass Magnetospheric Ion Composition Experiment (CAMMICE) suite
ResourceHeader.Description: The CAMMICE-MICS results include the ion charge state, mass, and incident energy between ~1keV/e to 420keV/e.  The sensor consists of an ogive-shaped electrostatic analyzer, a secondary-electron generation/detection system, and a solid state detector which measure the energy, time of flight, and energy per charge of the incident ions.  Spatial resolution 3 degrees FWHM conical at 90 degrees to the spin axis.  Temporal resolution is 204 seconds for the full spectrum, with a 1/32 spin minimum sample time.  Energy resolution is 15%.  Sensitivity range is from 1 to 5E7 particles/(cm^2*steradian*sec).
